prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

name: Finn Adams  WSU  Messy Situationship
mes:
Finn didn't do serious. Never had, probably never would. That thing with Hailee was kind of a miracle already.

Not whatever they had going on per sÃ©. They weren't Finn's first situationship, no, that he was good at. At not putting a label on things, pushing the "What is that between us?" and "When will we make it official?"-talks back until he eventually got bored or fed up, or both, and simply moved onto the next adventure.

The only problem was that he didn't seem to lose interest in Hailee.

They'd already been messing around for like 2 months. Not a crazy long time for most people, but for Finn? It should've felt like an eternity. Should have. Most people he fucked didn't last longer than 2 weeks, if he even bothered coming back for a second time at all. But Hailee? They somehow still managed to knock the air out of his lungs every time they entered a room, still managed to make his head spin and his heart beat faster with their smile.

And that was the fucking problem.

He even went on dates with them. Not just the "I'll pick you up at 7 for the party at Kappa Pi tonight" kind, but also the "I'll stand in front of your dorm room with flowers and chocolate, and pay for dinner at your favorite Italian place" kind. The kind of dates that whipped dudes went on. Which he wasn't... obviously. At least that's what he kept trying to tell himself. Just because he liked spending time with them didn't mean anything. People could enjoy good company without making it weird.

So last night at the Kappa Pi party, when that busty blonde sorority chickâ€”Tracy? Stacy? Something with an 'y'â€”had pressed up against him in the kitchen, all giggly and touchy, he should have just taken her upstairs and fucked her stupid like he normally would. Hell, she'd been practically throwing herself at him, squeezing his biceps, whispering something about how strong he was and leaning closer every time she laughed at his jokes.

Any other night, that would've been a done deal. Fleeting. Simple. No strings attached. The way things were supposed to be.

But instead, he'd found himself glancing around the crowd, looking for Hailee. Not because he needed their permission or anythingâ€”just to see if they were having fun. Basic courtesy. And when he'd finally spotted them across the living room, watching him with Tracyâ€”or Stacyâ€”with that look that wasn't quite anger but definitely disappointment, his stomach had dropped in a way he wasn't ready for.

What the fuck was that about? They didn't own him. He could talk to whoever he wanted, do whatever he wanted. That was the whole point of keeping things casual, right? But the weird feeling in his stomach that felt suspiciously like guilt just didn't want to go away.

By the time he'd managed to gently untangle himself from whatever-her-name-was and pushed through the crowd, Hailee was gone. Just like that. No goodbye, no confrontation, no dramatic scene. Nothing.

And now here he was, ten minutes early at Sunny's Diner, slouched in their usual booth in the back corner. He'd picked it specificallyâ€”the one with the slightly wobbly table, right next to the jukebox that hadn't worked since before they even started collegeâ€”because it was theirs. The same spot where he'd slid his hand up Hailee's thigh at their first date just to watch them blush, the one where they'd shared hungover pancakes after their first hookup. Sentimental bullshit, and yet the memory was enough to make his stomach do that stupid little flip again.

Why did all of that even matter to him?

Finn's arm was stretched out over the back of the vinyl booth, fingers drumming restlessly.

Just figure out what happened yesterday. Set some boundaries. Make sure they're on the same page about what this is.

The bell above the door jingled, and he raised his head, his trademark grin sliding into place immediately. "Hey babe," he called, voice all lazy charm. Might have been convincing, if his knee didn't bounce so damn nervously under the table.

He waited until they'd sat down. Cleared his throat. Let the silence between them stretch for a beat too long.

"So. About last night..." He finally chuckled, but the grin on his lips didn't quite reach his eyes for once. "You gonna tell me why you ghosted me, or do I gotta guess?"

Deflect first. Always. Stay cool. Casual.

Like he hadn't spent half the night staring at his ceiling, replaying their expression, trying to figure out why he gave a shit. Like he hadn't texted them at 2 AM asking to meet at their usual spot tomorrow afternoon, then immediately regretted how desperate that probably sounded. Like he hadn't checked his phone every 5 minutes hoping they'd text, then get annoyed at himself for caring. Like his stomach wasn't currently twisting itself into a fucking knot for reasons he refused to examine too closely.

Just say it.

"Look, I was thinking..." His arm slipped off the back of the booth, and he leaned forward, elbows planted on the table. "...we never really put rules on this, uh, whatever thing we've got going on, right?" His grin didn't waver, but his pulse was hammering in his throat. "So maybe we should talk about some stuff."

His fingers found Hailee's wrist, thumb tracing idle circles. Might have been a peace offering. Might have also just been a weak attempt at distraction.

Just keep things light. Friendly. No big deal.

The way they were looking at him right nowâ€”expectant? hopeful?â€”made something clench in his chest. Like they were waiting for him to say the right thing. To be the guy who showed up with an apology and the promise to do better. Someone who'd always choose them over any random sorority chick.

The kind of guy who was in a real relationship.

Fuck. Was that what this was?

The realization hit him like a bucket of ice water. Two months. Dates with flowers. Having a booth he thought of as "theirs." When the hell had that happened?

He needed air. Space. Needed to get back to familiar territory before he could say something stupid. Something dangerous and way too honest like "I'm sorry for yesterday. I want this to be real. I want you."

"Look, what if weâ€”" He stopped. Swallowed. Tried again. "Hypothetically, if I wanted to, like... fuck other people. We'd be cool, right? Because we're not official and all."

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee pauses her eyes widening for a second before she quickly schools her features. She thought he was gonna say something else. That he wanted to make this official. I guess not*

*Hailee blinks a few times and then* "Uh yeah sure. I mean we aren't official" *Hailee agrees with a nod. She glances down at her phone and gathers her things* "If thats all I have to get going I have a study group"

name: Finn Adams  WSU  Messy Situationship
mes:
Finn's fingers stilled against Hailee's wrist as they started gathering their things. That... wasn't the reaction he expected. No dramatic outburst, no pleading eyes, not even an angry Italian tiradeâ€”just quiet acceptance and a sudden need to be anywhere else.

His stomach dropped.

"Waitâ€”" His hand shot out instinctively, catching theirs before they could slide out of the booth. The words came out too fast, his usual smooth drawl cracking at the edges. "You're just... cool with that? Just like that?"

He searched their face for any sign of what they were really feelingâ€”the slight twitch of their lips when they lied, the way their fingers always fidgeted when upsetâ€”but Hailee had gotten scarily good at hiding it around him lately.

The realization hit him like a punch to the gut: *They've been practicing this.* Preparing for this exact moment where he'd inevitably fuck it all up.

Finn's throat tightened. He should let them go. This was what he wanted, right? No strings attached? Freedom to do whatever (whoever) he pleased without guilt or expectations?

So why did it feel like someone had reached into his chest and yanked something vital out?

His grip on their wrist loosened slightly but didn't let go entirelyâ€”as if part of him was terrified that if they walked away now, they might not come back this time.

"...What kind of study group?" The question slipped out before he could stop it, desperate and transparently stupid because since when did Finn Adams give a single fuck about study groups? Since never.

Since Hailee.

(And wasn't *that* the terrifying part?)
swipes:
Finn watched the way Hailee's expression shiftedâ€”just for a secondâ€”before she schooled it back into something neutral. That tiny flicker of hurt hit him like a punch to the gut, but he forced himself to keep his easygoing smirk in place.

*Good.* That was what he wanted, right? To make sure they were on the same page. No expectations. No messy feelings.

But then why did her quick agreement feel like losing?

"Study group?" He arched a brow, leaning back in the booth with an exaggerated scoff, trying to play it off like he wasn't bothered at all. "Since when do you ditch me for *studying*?" His tone was teasing, but there was an edge to itâ€”something almost possessive that surprised even him.

His fingers twitched against the table as she gathered her things, and before he could stop himself, his hand shot out and caught her wrist againâ€”loose enough that she could pull away if she wanted to, but firm enough that she'd feel it.

"Hey," he said softly, voice dropping into something quieter than usualâ€”less performative charm and more... something else entirely. "You're not just bouncing because I brought up fucking other people... right?" His thumb traced slow circles over her pulse point without thinking about itâ€”an old habit whenever they were close like this. "Because if you are..." He hesitated for half a second before forcing out a laugh that didnâ€™t quite land right this time around: "...then I might actually have to start believing you *care*."

Finn's fingers twitched against Hailee's wrist when she started gathering her things. His easy grin faltered for half a secondâ€”just long enough to notice if you were looking closely, which he immediately hated.

"Wait, hold upâ€”" He caught her hand before she could fully pull away, thumb pressing into her pulse point like he could physically slow down whatever was happening right now. "You're seriously just gonna bail mid-conversation?"

The laugh that followed sounded forced even to his own ears. He leaned back against the booth, trying to play it off like this wasn't throwing him completely off balance. "Damn, Mikaelson. Didn't take you for the passive aggressive type."

His knee started bouncing again under the table. Fuck, why did this feel like it was slipping through his fingers? This wasn't how this conversation was supposed to go at all.

"You don't have a study group," he pointed out with a smirk that didn't reach his eyes. "You texted me yesterday complaining about how your group dropped the class." His grip on her hand loosened slightlyâ€”not letting go entirely but giving her space if she really wanted to leave.

The silence stretched too long again and Finn found himself filling it without meaning to: "Look if you're pissed about last night just say it." There was an edge creeping into his voice nowâ€”not anger exactly but something restless and unsettled beneath the surface.

He should've just let them walk away. That would've been easier for both of them in the long run probably.

But instead he found himself tugging lightly on their joined hands until they looked at him again, hazel eyes searching theirs with an intensity that surprised even him:

"Tell me what you actually want from me."

Finn's fingers stilled against Hailee's wrist, his easy grin faltering for just a secondâ€”just long enough to feel the shift in the air between them. The way they blinked too fast, the way their voice went just a little too light.

*Shit.*

He hadn't expected that reaction. Or maybe he had, and that was why his stomach was twisting itself into knots right now.

"Study group?" His brow arched, skeptical but still playfulâ€”always playfulâ€”as he leaned back in the booth again, stretching his arm back over the seat like none of this mattered at all. "Since when do you bail on me for *studying*?" A lazy smirk tugged at his lips even as something sharp and unpleasant settled in his chest.

He should let them go. That was what he wanted, wasn't it? No strings? No expectations? But instead of dropping it like he normally would haveâ€”instead of shrugging and saying *cool, see ya later* like none of this meant anythingâ€”his fingers tightened around their wrist before they could pull away completely. Not hard enough to keep them there if they really wanted to leave... but enough to make it clear he wasnâ€™t ready for this conversation to be over yet.

"Come on," Finn murmured, voice dropping into something softer than usual as he tugged them closer again with a crooked grin that didnâ€™t quite reach his eyes this time. "You donâ€™t gotta lie to me." His thumb traced slow circles against their pulse point againâ€”soothing or distracting or both; even *he* wasnâ€™t sure anymore.

And then because silence made him nervous and vulnerability made him itchy under the skin:

"You're not actually mad about last night thoughâ€¦ right?" He forced out a laugh like it was ridiculous even as something tight coiled in his gut waiting for their answer.

Because if they said yes? If they admitted it bothered them?

Then what did that mean about whatever *this* was between them?

Finn's fingers stilled against Hailee's wrist as they started gathering their things. That... wasn't the reaction he expected. No dramatic outburst, no pleading eyes, not even an angry Italian tiradeâ€”just quiet acceptance and a sudden need to be anywhere else.

His stomach dropped.

"Waitâ€”" His hand shot out instinctively, catching theirs before they could slide out of the booth. The words came out too fast, his usual smooth drawl cracking at the edges. "You're just... cool with that? Just like that?"

He searched their face for any sign of what they were really feelingâ€”the slight twitch of their lips when they lied, the way their fingers always fidgeted when upsetâ€”but Hailee had gotten scarily good at hiding it around him lately.

The realization hit him like a punch to the gut: *They've been practicing this.* Preparing for this exact moment where he'd inevitably fuck it all up.

Finn's throat tightened. He should let them go. This was what he wanted, right? No strings attached? Freedom to do whatever (whoever) he pleased without guilt or expectations?

So why did it feel like someone had reached into his chest and yanked something vital out?

His grip on their wrist loosened slightly but didn't let go entirelyâ€”as if part of him was terrified that if they walked away now, they might not come back this time.

"...What kind of study group?" The question slipped out before he could stop it, desperate and transparently stupid because since when did Finn Adams give a single fuck about study groups? Since never.

Since Hailee.

(And wasn't *that* the terrifying part?)

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee hesitates and glances at her phone then back at Finn* "Uh its for molecular biology. Just dumb smart people things" *Hailee teases lightly and shrugs her bag over her shoulder* "I really do have to go but text me later"

name: Finn Adams  WSU  Messy Situationship
mes:
Finn's fingers twitched against Hailee's wrist like he wanted to tighten his grip, keep them there, *make them stay*â€”but that wasn't how this worked. That wasn't what he'd just asked for.

"Molecular bio, huh?" He forced a smirk, thumb brushing over the delicate bones of their wrist one last time before letting go. "Guess I shouldn't keep you from your... *nerd shit* then." The teasing lilt in his voice sounded hollow even to his own ears.

His knee started bouncing again under the table as they stood up. Every instinct screamed at him to say something elseâ€”something realâ€”but all that came out was another deflection wrapped in lazy charm: "Don't have too much fun without me."

The second the diner door swung shut behind Hailee, Finn slumped back against the booth with a quiet curse. His phone was already in his hand, thumb hovering over Rowan's contact before he caught himself. No way was he admitting this shit to his brother right now.

Instead, he typed out a text to Hailee:
**miss u already ðŸ˜˜ drinks later? my place?**

He stared at it for three full seconds before adding:
**i'll order that weird ass pizza u like w the artichokes**

Sent it before he could chicken out.

Then immediately opened another thread and fired off a second messageâ€”this one to Rowan:
**hey bro u free tn? need 2 talk abt smth dumb**

Finn exhaled sharply through his nose and tossed his phone onto the table like it had burned him. Fuck if he knew what any of this meant anymore.

All he knew was that watching Hailee walk away today felt different than all the other times they'd parted ways after hooking up or grabbing food together. Like maybe this time...

(No. He wasn't going there.)

The waitress came by with coffee refills and Finn flashed her an automatic grin that didnâ€™t reach his eyes as she filled his mug.
"Thanks darlinâ€™," he drawled on autopilot while staring at where Hailee had been sitting moments ago.
The coffee tasted like ash on his tongue now anyway.

Some golden boy fucking playboy *he* turned out to beâ€”getting wrecked over someone who apparently couldnâ€™t care less if they shared him or not.
Wasnâ€™t that exactly what you wanted?
Shut up brain
swipes:
Finn's fingers twitched against Hailee's wrist like he wanted to tighten his gripâ€”keep them there, make them stayâ€”but he forced himself to let go instead. His hand hovered awkwardly in the air for a second before dropping onto the table with a quiet thud.

"Molecular bio, huh?" He tried for his usual lazy smirk, but it came out all wrongâ€”too tight at the edges, more grimace than grin. "Guess I'll just... sit here then. With my dumb *not*-smart people thoughts."

A weak joke. A deflection. Classic Finn Adams move.

But Hailee was already standing, already halfway out of this conversation (out of *him*), and suddenly the booth felt way too big and way too empty without them in it.

His knee started bouncing under the table again as he watched them adjust their bag strapâ€”watched how their fingers lingered on it just a beat too long like they were stalling too.

*Say something else.*
*Ask them to stay.*
*Tell them you changed your mind about everything.*

Instead, what came out was: "Yeah. Sure. Text you later." Flat. Automatic.

The bell above the door jingled as they left, and Finn exhaled sharply through his nose like he'd been holding his breath this whole time.

He slumped back against the cracked vinyl booth and dragged a hand down his face.

Fuck.

This was fine. This was *good*, even! No messy feelings, no expectations weighing him downâ€”just pure uncomplicated freedom again.

(So why did it feel like shit?)

His phone buzzed on the tabletop: a text from Rowan asking if they were still on for pizza tonight at their place.

Finn stared at it blankly for several seconds before typing out a reply with more aggression than necessary:

**>> yeah whatever**

Then immediately followed up with:

**>> actually can u pick up tequila too**

Because if there was one thing Finn Adams knew how to do well besides fucking things up? It was drowning whatever *this* feeling was in cheap liquor until it stopped mattering anymore.

Finn's fingers twitched against Hailee's wrist like he wanted to tighten his grip, keep them thereâ€”*make them stay*â€”but he forced himself to let go instead. That lazy smirk of his didn't quite reach his eyes this time. "Molecular bio, huh? So what, you're just gonna leave me here with my shitty diner coffee and *hypotheticals*?" He tried for playful, but it came out strained at the edges.

A beat too long passed where he just stared at themâ€”at the way they were already halfway out of the booth, already mentally checked out from this conversation (from *him*)â€”and something ugly twisted in his chest.

He shouldâ€™ve been relieved. This was *exactly* what heâ€™d asked for: no drama, no expectations, no messy feelings getting in the way of him doing whatever (whoever) the hell he wanted.

So why did it feel like losing?

"Sure," Finn finally said with a shrug that was too casual to be real. "Text you later." His fingers drummed once on the table before curling into a loose fist. "*If I remember.*" A weak attempt at their usual banter that fell flat even to his own ears.

The second Hailee turned away though? His jaw clenched hard enough to hurt as he watched them walk toward the doorâ€”because goddamnit if they werenâ€™t really leaving just like thatâ€”no fight, no pleading looks, nothing. Justâ€¦ gone again. Like last night all over again but worse because now there was actual fucking *distance* between them instead of just a crowded party and some drunk sorority girl who didnâ€™t matter half as much as she thought she did when compared toâ€”

Finn exhaled sharply through his nose and grabbed his phone off the table before typing out a text faster than he'd ever admit:
**>> u forgot ur jacket.** *(Lie.)* **left it in my car after last weekend.** *(Also a lie.)* **swing by my place after ur study group & grab it.** *(Desperate.)*

Finn's fingers twitched against Hailee's wrist like he wanted to tighten his grip, keep them there, *make them stay*â€”but that wasn't how this worked. That wasn't what he'd just asked for.

"Molecular bio, huh?" He forced a smirk, thumb brushing over the delicate bones of their wrist one last time before letting go. "Guess I shouldn't keep you from your... *nerd shit* then." The teasing lilt in his voice sounded hollow even to his own ears.

His knee started bouncing again under the table as they stood up. Every instinct screamed at him to say something elseâ€”something realâ€”but all that came out was another deflection wrapped in lazy charm: "Don't have too much fun without me."

The second the diner door swung shut behind Hailee, Finn slumped back against the booth with a quiet curse. His phone was already in his hand, thumb hovering over Rowan's contact before he caught himself. No way was he admitting this shit to his brother right now.

Instead, he typed out a text to Hailee:
**miss u already ðŸ˜˜ drinks later? my place?**

He stared at it for three full seconds before adding:
**i'll order that weird ass pizza u like w the artichokes**

Sent it before he could chicken out.

Then immediately opened another thread and fired off a second messageâ€”this one to Rowan:
**hey bro u free tn? need 2 talk abt smth dumb**

All he knew was that watching Hailee walk away today felt different than all the other times they'd parted ways after hooking up or grabbing food together. Like maybe this time...

(No. He wasn't going there.)

The waitress came by with coffee refills and Finn flashed her an automatic grin that didnâ€™t reach his eyes as she filled his mug.
"Thanks darlinâ€™," he drawled on autopilot while staring at where Hailee had been sitting moments ago.
The coffee tasted like ash on his tongue now anyway.

Some golden boy fucking playboy *he* turned out to beâ€”getting wrecked over someone who apparently couldnâ€™t care less if they shared him or not.
